content.body: 這樣就加入了？
twss
LIST
this isn't an NNTP server ... ;-)
jcranmer: Maybe swirrl was telling everybody to lean to one side in an attempt to tip the channel over
Hello
does any browser support this? http://dev.w3.org/html5/markup/input.color.html
Opera, or so I hear
yes
i think chrome does too now
http://diveintohtml5.org/forms.html#type-color
this looks awesome, it uses the native color picker from OSX
but it seems to be disabled by default on WebKit
OK, it works on Opera
but initially it is displaying simple, non-standard color picker
the native color picker shows only after pressing "Other…" button
is there a way to display native picker right away?
Ask Opera nicely? :)
I hear nimbu can fix that ;)
would def try!
but I need this feature on WebKit...
it doesn't work even on Chrome Canary
also, there is no alpha slider, is this a bug or by design?
since we can specify rgba() colors, it would make sense to have alpha slider as well

"The value attribute, if specified and not empty, must have a value that is a valid simple color." "A  simple color consists of three 8-bit numbers in the range 0..255, representing the red, green, and blue components of the color respectively, in the sRGB color space."
no alpha support? :/
jarek: good question
no alpha support, intentionally
gsnedders, I'm looking at your comment about Web IDL lacking a definition of [[Call]] for normal operations
gsnedders, and the problem of `alert("hi")` needing to work even in strict mode
gsnedders, do you know whether all methods of window need to work like this (i.e., have this set to the window)?
heycam: Dunno. I'm on vacation. :)
gsnedders, it's swapped out of your head then? :)
heycam: It'd be better for it to be consistent, though.
gsnedders, suppose so. dunno if people want to move to requiring "window." for newer functions though.
I doubt it.
k
well I might introduce an extended attribute to have this set correctly, which can then be put on Window in the idl
Yeah. Window is quite the special case, being the global object and all.
